ddf.catalog.source.opensearch

Class OpenSearchSiteUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • ddf.catalog.source.opensearch.OpenSearchSiteUtil

  • public final class OpenSearchSiteUtil
extends Object
    Utility helper class that performs much of the translation logic used in CddaOpenSearchSite.

        searchPhrase -

      • populateTemporal

        public static void populateTemporal(org.apache.cxf.jaxrs.client.WebClient client,
                                    TemporalFilter temporal,
                                    List<String> parameters)
        Fills in the opensearch query URL with temporal information (Start, End, and Name). Currently name is empty due to incompatibility with endpoints.
        Parameters:
        client - OpenSearch URL to populate
        temporal - TemporalCriteria that contains temporal data

      • createPolyAryFromWKT

        public static String[] createPolyAryFromWKT(String wkt)
        Parses a WKT polygon string and returns a string array containing the lon and lat.
        Parameters:
        wkt - WKT String in the form of POLYGON((Lon Lat, Lon Lat...))
        Returns:
        Lon on even # and Lat on odd #

      • createLatLonAryFromWKT

        public static String[] createLatLonAryFromWKT(String wkt)
        Parses a WKT Point string and returns a string array containing the lon and lat.
        Parameters:
        wkt - WKT String in the form of POINT( Lon Lat)
        Returns:
        Lon at position 0, Lat at position 1

      • createBBoxFromPointRadius

        public static double[] createBBoxFromPointRadius(double lon,
                                                 double lat,
                                                 double radius)
        Takes in a point radius search and converts it to a (rough approximation) bounding box.
        Parameters:
        lon - latitude in decimal degrees (WGS-84)
        lat - longitude in decimal degrees (WGS-84)
        radius - radius, in meters
        Returns:
        Array of bounding box coordinates in the following order: West South East North. Also described as minX, minY, maxX, maxY (where longitude is the X-axis, and latitude is the Y-axis).

      • createBBoxFromPolygon

        public static double[] createBBoxFromPolygon(String[] polyAry)
        Takes in an array of coordinates and converts it to a (rough approximation) bounding box.

        Note: Searches being performed where the polygon goes through the international date line may return a bad bounding box.

        Parameters:
        polyAry - array of coordinates (lon,lat,lon,lat,lon,lat..etc)
        Returns:
        Array of bounding box coordinates in the following order: West South East North. Also described as minX, minY, maxX, maxY (where longitude is the X-axis, and latitude is the Y-axis).
